channel.title: Comments on: This Week in Genesis (8 Jul 2016)
channel.description: The best new WordPress Genesis things

item.title: By: Nick Davis
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://genesiswp.guide/2016-07-08/#comment-563">Tonya Mork</a>.
My pleasure, sounds like it's going to help a lot of people.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Tonya Mork.

My pleasure, sounds like it’s going to help a lot of people.

item.title: By: Nick Davis
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://genesiswp.guide/2016-07-08/#comment-562">Jackie D'Elia</a>.
Thanks Jackie!

item.title: By: Tonya Mork
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mork
item.description:
Hey Nick,
Thank you for including Know the Code and the shout out on the new book I'm writing:
Be a More Awesome Developer Roadmap to Continuously Level Up in WordPress.
I'm asked so often how to level up in web development. It's a natural transition to capture my experiences and put them into a resource for everyone. The book will give you a roadmap of "level up" habit and techniques you can use at various stages in your professional career. Plus I'll be throwing in some self-assessment tools too. One of my goals is to then use the book as a companion resource for what I'm doing at Know the Code.
As you know, I advocate that Genesis is "the developer's theming framework." (And nope, I don't work for StudioPress, i.e. Rainmaker, and I wasn't paid to say that either.) So I really get excited each week to see how folks in our community are using and building solution around it.
This guide is where I go to catch up on the happenings in our community. Keep up the good work!
Cheers and happy coding, Tonya
item.content:encoded:
Hey Nick,

Thank you for including Know the Code and the shout out on the new book I’m writing:

Be a More Awesome Developer
Roadmap to Continuously Level Up in WordPress.

I’m asked so often how to level up in web development. It’s a natural transition to capture my experiences and put them into a resource for everyone. The book will give you a roadmap of “level up” habit and techniques you can use at various stages in your professional career. Plus I’ll be throwing in some self-assessment tools too. One of my goals is to then use the book as a companion resource for what I’m doing at Know the Code.

As you know, I advocate that Genesis is “the developer’s theming framework.” (And nope, I don’t work for StudioPress, i.e. Rainmaker, and I wasn’t paid to say that either.) So I really get excited each week to see how folks in our community are using and building solution around it.

This guide is where I go to catch up on the happenings in our community. Keep up the good work!

Cheers and happy coding,
Tonya

item.title: By: Jackie D'Elia
item.dc:creator: Jackie D'Elia
item.description:
Hi Nick, This is my favorite week in review - hands down. I love how it helps to foster friendships, sharing and accolades in the community. Keep Genesis Awesome!
Thank you!!
item.content:encoded:
Hi Nick,
This is my favorite week in review – hands down. I love how it helps to foster friendships, sharing and accolades in the community. Keep Genesis Awesome!

Thank you!!

item.title: By: Susan Ramsey
item.dc:creator: Susan Ramsey
item.description:
Great post, Nick - I often don't have time during the week to keep up to date with the happenings in the #GenesisWP community, so I look forward to your update each Friday to catch up on what's been happening. As you said, it was a pretty busy week this week!
Thank you for the mentions!
item.content:encoded:
Great post, Nick – I often don’t have time during the week to keep up to date with the happenings in the #GenesisWP community, so I look forward to your update each Friday to catch up on what’s been happening. As you said, it was a pretty busy week this week!

Thank you for the mentions!
